semantic_identifier: 151: fix: Fix Jira/Linear link-out deep links and show “Not linked” state for invalid external IDs

sections.text:
## Description

This PR fixes broken/misdirected Jira/Linear link-outs rendered from Issue_Tracker by making deep-link generation integration-aware and adding validation/fallback UI.

Changes:
- Deep link generation now uses the integration’s configured base URL + workspace/org slug (instead of assuming a single global format), producing correct URLs across workspaces.
- Added external ID/key validation before rendering a link:
  - Jira: validate issue key shape (e.g., PROJECT-123) and ensure a baseUrl is present.
  - Linear: validate issue identifier format and ensure workspace slug is present.
- When the stored mapping is missing, malformed, or does not match the integration configuration, the UI renders a clear “Not linked” state instead of emitting a malformed anchor.
- Added a retry/reconnect action that triggers a re-sync/relink flow for the affected integration (for stale mappings).

User impact:
- Users will no longer land on 404s or the wrong downstream issue from Issue_Tracker link-outs.
- If an item is not properly linked, users see an explicit state with a one-click path to restore the connection.

Notes:
- No data migration; existing stored external IDs are validated at render time. Potentially stale/incorrect mappings will surface as “Not linked” until reconnected/resynced.

## How Has This Been Tested?

staging
